title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Jazz Outlast Magic in Orlando as Malone’s Herculean Effort Seals Road Win**

ORLANDO — On a night where offensive flow was often stymied, the Utah Jazz rode one of the game's titans to a gritty victory. Karl Malone, with a performance for the ages, delivered a stunning 42-point, 13-rebound masterpiece to will the Jazz past the Orlando Magic, 98-93.

From the opening tip, it was clear "The Mailman" would deliver. Malone was an unstoppable force, battering the Magic in the paint and from mid-range with a relentless efficiency that defied Orlando’s defensive schemes. His 42 points stood as a monumental testament to his power and scoring prowess, single-handedly keeping the Jazz offense afloat during stagnant stretches.

While Malone dominated the scoring column, his Hall-of-Fame partner, John Stockton, orchestrated the attack with a typical 14-point, 12-assist double-double. His steady hand and timely playmaking were the perfect complement to Malone's brute force.

The Magic, despite a valiant and balanced effort, had no answer for Malone’s historic night. Penny Hardaway paced Orlando with 23 points and 9 assists, while Shaquille O’Neal, in a rare off-night, was held to just 8 rebounds and 3 blocks. The interior battle was decisively won by the Jazz, with Greg Ostertag pulling down a game-high 16 rebounds to stifle Orlando's second-chance opportunities.

In the final, tense minutes, it was Malone who seized control, converting critical baskets to silence the home crowd and secure the hard-fought road win. This was not merely a game in the win column; it was a signature performance from one of the NBA's all-time greats, a night where Karl Malone carried his team to victory on his broad shoulders.
